summary: Mary Susan Grimes was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents provide her name, and in some cases, her annual salary and gross pay for specific periods. The documents do not specify her role within the SCAS, but her presence on payroll suggests she held an administrative or support position.
significance: Mary Susan Grimes' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While her specific role is not detailed in the provided documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the operations of the committee during its investigation.
